title: Love Island's Ovie Soko claims he's never met Maya Jama amid cheating rumours
text:

Love Island fan favourite Ovie Soko has slammed the rumours surrounding him and presenter Maya Jama.

Appearing on JD Sports' In the Duffle Bag podcast, he told host Chuckie that it was ridiculous that the rumours even existed as he's never met Maya.

The 28 year-old hunk said: "You know what's a joke? I've never met Maya. I've never met her in my life. I swear to God, I've never met her in my life."

The heartthrob, who won the affection of Love Island fans for his chilled attitude and humour, added: "They did filming for the very last [Love Island] Aftersun, which was at the villa, where she was there with two other talents and the whole cast we'd sort of shot - I think it was like a promo.

(Image: Dave Benett/Getty Images for ASO)

"You know, she was standing outside a door but, no, never met her in my life."

A representative for Maya, who recently split from grime star Stormzy, denied the allegations as well.

"They've never met so there's no truth to this," they said.

Ovie's still dating India Reynolds, who he met in the villa. The pair finished third, behind runners-up Tommy Fury and Molly-Mae Hague, and winners Greg O'Shea and Amber Gill.

They've already been rocked by cheating rumours, as India was accused of snogging her ex, footballer Kieran Gibbs, a claim which she denies.

(Image: Colin Hawkins photography/Lovehoney)

Ovie also hit out at rumours that his and India's relationship is "on the rocks".

"I don't read too much into rumours," he said, "I don't read too much into newspapers, I generally don't read this stuff - I'm busy, man."

Ovie continued that he was confused by Love Island's Casa Amor, as he thought he was going straight into the main villa.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

The basketball player laughed: "When they told me Casa Amor, I thought it was the main villa.

"I got there and it took me a day to realise this ain't the actual villa."

He's got big plans going into the future, and fully intends to keep up his current career momentum.

Ovie dished: "I'll be playing basketball still, obviously not at the same level, but I plan to play back here in the UK, in London - it's a part of me and I still just want to do that.

"Opportunities are presenting themselves. Obviously, I love fashion, I do love TV, I love the whole entertainment world, I find it pretty cool.

"I would say everything I do now is just things that I've thought through and they're just true to me."
description: Ovie was on JD Sports' podcast when he dismissed rumours of a romance between him and Maya, saying that he's never even met her
authors: Dave Benett Getty Images For Aso
